channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: McConnell to Republican candidates: Distance from Trump if necessary
item.description: Sen. Mitch McConnell is allowing Republican Senate candidates to do whatever it takes to salvage their campaigns ahead of what Republicans increasingly fear could be a devastating election for their party.

item.title: Joe Biden narrows down his VP list, and a dark-horse candidate emerges
item.description: Joe Biden heads into the weekend weighing the biggest decision of his presidential campaign so far, and people close to the process tell CNN that the former vice president is believed to have now begun to narrow his personal shortlist of potential running mates to a handful of women.

item.title: Jake Tapper: How on Earth can Congress adjourn for the weekend?
item.description: The House and Senate have adjourned for the weekend without coming to an agreement on a new economic stimulus package despite the looming deadline for unemployment benefits that many have relied on during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Manu Raju discusses with Jake Tapper.

item.title: China's Three Gorges Dam is one of the largest ever created. Was it worth it?
item.description: Three Gorges Dam is the largest hydropower project ever built.

item.title: Trump says he will ban TikTok
item.description: President Donald Trump said Friday night that he will ban the popular short-form video app TikTok from operating in the United States, rejecting a potential deal for Microsoft to buy the app from its Chinese-owned parent company.

item.title: Taiwan could become the next flashpoint in the global tech war
item.description: The world is becoming increasingly dependent on a Taiwanese company for the most advanced semiconductors, after a stumble by rival Intel. But TSMC is trying to pull off a high-wire act by keeping both China and the United States happy at a time of rapidly escalating geopolitical tensions.

item.title: Six democracy activists including US citizen wanted in Hong Kong: state media
item.description: Hong Kong police have issued arrest warrants for six overseas-based democracy activists who are alleged to have breached the city's newly imposed national security law, according to Chinese state media.

item.title: Fauci explains why Europe contained the pandemic better than the US
Not enough Americans wearing masks, researcher says
Dr. Fauci and Jim Jordan get in heated exchange over protests
item.description: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) gets in a fiery exchange with Dr. Anthony Fauci over whether protests should be limited in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Hong Kong is setting up a postponed election without a real opposition
James Murdoch resigns from News Corp board over 'editorial content'
item.description: James Murdoch resigned from the board of his family's company News Corp on Friday, citing "disagreements over certain editorial content published by the Company's news outlets and certain other strategic decisions."

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Magic star is first NBA player to stand for National Anthem and not wear Black Lives Matter shirt
item.description: The Orlando Magic's Jonathan Isaac became the first NBA player to stand for the National Anthem as the league resumed play after a 20-week hiatus due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Newly unsealed documents describe Ghislaine Maxwell's alleged abuse of one of Epstein's victims
item.description: Virginia Giuffre, an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein, describes the psychological toll of Epstein's abuse in portions of a newly released deposition from May 3, 2016.

item.title: US state has trapped its first 'murder hornet'
item.description: Washington state has trapped its first Asian giant hornet -- or, what we've come to know as the "murder hornet."

item.title: Trump was put on speakerphone in restaurant during conversation with senator
item.description: President Donald Trump was put on speakerphone in a restaurant during a conversation with Senate Armed Services Chairman Jim Inhofe Wednesday, where the two discussed Trump's opposition to changing the names of US military bases named after Confederate officials, according to The New York Times.

item.title: Serial killer confesses involvement in more than 50 murders
item.description: An Indian serial killer who admitted his involvement in the murder of more than 50 taxi drivers whose bodies were dumped in a crocodile-infested canal has been caught by police after he fled to another state while out of prison on parole.

item.title: He held up a Black Lives Matter sign not far from KKK headquarters and recorded the reactions
item.description: A White filmmaker traveled to a town just outside the headquarters of the Ku Klux Klan to document reactions to him holding a Black Lives Matter sign.

item.title: Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence overturned
item.description: A federal appeals court ruled on Friday to vacate the death sentence of convicted Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.

item.title: Florida teen arrested in Twitter hack that hit Biden and Obama
item.description: A teenager in Tampa was arrested and charged Friday for his alleged involvement in a massive Twitter hack earlier this month that took over the accounts of prominent users like Joe Biden, Bill Gates and Elon Musk and used them to promote a bitcoin scam.

item.title: Woman says she was forcibly sterilized by Chinese government
item.description: Zumrat Dawut says she was forcibly sterilized by the Chinese government for having one too many children.

item.title: US Navy's first Black female tactical jet pilot gets her 'wings of gold'
item.description: The US Navy's first Black female tactical aircraft pilot, Lt. j.g. Madeline Swegle, received her "wings of gold" on Friday, marking a historic milestone for naval aviation.

item.title: Fact checking Trump's claim that he is tough on Russia
item.description: Despite his claim that he is tough on Russia, President Donald Trump says he has not discussed US intelligence reports accusing Russia of offering bounties to Taliban fighters to kill US troops with President Vladimir Putin. CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down 37 times Trump was soft on Russia.

item.title: Trump's trashing of democracy will reverberate far beyond the US
LAPD releases video showing protester shot in head with 'less-lethal' round
item.description: A protester had his hands raised when Los Angeles police shot him in the head with a "less-lethal projectile" during a May demonstration, body camera videos released Friday show.

item.title: The US economy is teetering on the brink of disaster, and the Senate adjourned for the weekend
item.description: The unemployment benefit that has kept millions afloat amid the worst economic crisis in decades officially expires at midnight. Weekly jobless claims continue to rise. Economic forecasters are warning of another slowdown. The coronavirus has resurged across the country.

item.title: How the Kurds are in Syria doing nine months after the US left
item.description: CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

item.title: See the Nike ad everyone's talking about
item.description: Nike's latest ad sends a powerful message about Covid-19 and the Black Lives Matter movement. At a time when professional sports are struggling to start up amidst the pandemic, the ad has quickly become popular online.

item.title: Bronx Zoo apologizes for putting African man on display in Monkey House
item.description: For one week in 1906, the Bronx Zoo in New York kept a man from Central Africa in an enclosure in its monkey house

item.title: In Italy, masks have become a fashion statement not a political statement
item.description: CNN's Barbie Latza Nadeau reports from Rome on how Italians are attempting to prevent a second wave of coronavirus infections by wearing masks.

item.title: Why Black women are more likely to have fibroids than any other race group
item.description: Stephanie Odili knew something was wrong when her stomach ballooned to three times its usual size.

item.title: When the US might expect to get a Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: CNN's Elizabeth Cohen talks to Dr. Moncef Slaoui, chief adviser to "Operation Warp Speed," the federal government's Covid-19 vaccine program, about when Americans can expect a vaccine to be available and how effective it could be.

item.title: Beyonc's visual album 'Black Is King' is a feast for the eyes
item.description: There are many quotable lines and lyrics in "Black Is King," Beyonc's new visual album, which dropped today on Disney+. But two in particular seem especially apt to describe the stylistic feast the artist has created. The first comes three minutes in: "Let Black be synonymous with joy."

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres apologizes to staff after report of toxic culture at talk show
item.description: Ellen DeGeneres is apologizing to her staff in the wake of allegations that her talk show fosters a toxic environment.

item.title: How Ethiopian art secured its spot on the world's stage
item.description: Over the last five years contemporary Ethiopian artists have been making a name for themselves on the global art market, but it's been a long time coming.

item.title: How Toblerone chocolate became connected with air travel
item.description: Toblerone may not be the most famous chocolate brand in the world, but it's arguably the most iconic -- especially when it comes to travel.

item.title: Bizarre sculpture unveiled in the heart of London
item.description: A giant swirl of whipped cream topped with a cherry, a fly and a drone has become the latest artwork to sit atop Trafalgar Square's Fourth Plinth -- the stage for a constantly changing series of artworks.

item.title: Stunning photos of the world's remotest tribes
item.description: In 2013, the British photographer Jimmy Nelson published his first monograph, a 400-page photo book titled "Before They Pass Away." His subjects were shot in some of the world's most remote wildernesses, showing us, in monumental fashion, the lives and cultures of some of the world's most isolated and ancient indigenous communities.

item.title: The art world has a money laundering problem
item.description: Shell companies with hidden owners. Middlemen who shield the identities of buyers and sellers. Inadequate safeguards to keep out shady money.

item.title: This uniquely Hong Kong snack is popping up around the world
item.description: When I decided to write a story about the origins of Hong Kong bubble waffles -- also known as "egg waffles" -- I thought it would be easy.

item.title: Permanent WFH sounds great. But it's harder than it sounds
item.description: The spread of Coronavirus forced many companies to go remote. And some have already pledged to make the work style permanent.

item.title: What we've gotten wrong about how sperm move
item.description: Using complex mathematics and 3D imaging, a group of researchers at the University of Bristol have discovered human sperm doesn't move the way we have believed for centuries

item.title: Meet Forest, the tallest giraffe in the world
item.description: A male giraffe living in a zoo in Australia has been crowned the tallest of them all, hitting a giddy 5.7 meters (18 feet, 8 inches).

item.title: Trump's own intelligence officials debunk his repeated claims of mail-in voting fraud
item.description: US intelligence officials on Friday discounted the possibility of foreign countries mass producing fake ballots to interfere in the November elections, contradicting President Donald Trump's continued insistence that mail-in voting poses a significant threat to election security.

item.title: 3 charts show how Republicans are losing chance to keep Senate
item.description: Leading election forecasters have been steadily downgrading their ratings for Republican Senate candidates throughout the year, increasing the chances of a Democratic takeover viewed as unlikely only a few months ago.

item.title: Trump's trashing of democracy reverberates beyond US
item.description: When you are President of the United States, your words matter. Not just to your own voters, not just to your own citizens, but to people in every corner of the planet.

item.title: Group prepares for chance Trump refuses to concede election
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett talks with Col. Lawrence Wilkerson (Ret.), who is part of a bipartisan group that has been meeting to game out scenarios if President Trump loses the election in November and refuses to concede. Trump has suggested delaying the November election because the pandemic complicates the voting process.

item.title: Fauci explains why Europe contained the pandemic better
item.description: US states' "diversity of response" hampered the country's ability to contain the spread of the coronavirus, Dr. Anthony Fauci said at a Congressional hearing on Friday.

item.title: Hong Kong is setting up a postponed election without a real opposition
item.description: Activists cry foul as Hong Kong postpones election for a year, citing Covid-19 fears
